FuncDef:
The daa-user resource-insufficient command enables the system to force a DAA user to log out if the DAA user fails to apply for resources.
The undo daa-user resource-insufficient command restores the default value.
By default, the system keeps the user online when the user's request fails.
CLIs: daa-user resource-insufficient { { inbound | outbound } * | both } offline

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies insufficient upstream and downstream resources.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The daa-user resource-insufficient command and the undo daa-user resource-insufficient command are used to configure the system to keep the user online or force the user to log out when the user's request fails.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
